settings.text: We are dedicated to fashion and culture photgraphy, a distinctively refined, on-the-pulse and stylish worldview.

With the major shifts in the media world, we will all soon be nostalgic about that incredible creative talent that was bubbling on a set and populated major glossies. 

Founded in February 2018 in New York City, The Selects Gallery’s mission is to create a platform dedicated to Fashion photography to discover, learn and acquire the works of renowned international photographers.

We comb through the archives of the most iconic past and present beauty and fashion photographers to unearth their hidden gems. We leverage the power of online and offline media to share their story, artistic approach and point of view on society with a wider audience.

settings.question: Limited Edition
settings.answer: All photographs sold at The Selects Gallery are strictly limited in edition size. They are available until sold out and never reproduced again. We work in close partnership with the artists and estates as a primary market gallery. In many cases we are their exclusive gallery. We therefore control the provenance of each artwork to ensure market value.

settings.question: Certificate of Authenticity
settings.answer: The Certificate of Authenticity is a document that certifies that the sold artwork is an authentic creation by the artist and will include the edition number. In most cases, the certificate of authenticity will come separately from the mounted piece. Expertly Crafted Quality.

settings.question: Archival Quality Prints
settings.answer: We partner with one of the fine art photography printing house with the longest history and connection to the photography world, and print under the supervision of the photographers and/or their estate. We select high end papers for their optimal rendering based on the image and mounting choice. In some cases, the print is shipped directly by the estate or the artist, and they select the printing house and paper.

settings.question: Mounting & Framing
settings.answer: Prints are professionally mounted on High grade acrylic, aluminum clad panels or foamcore. Every frame is made to measure and assembled by hand in the US. We use the US manufacturer Larson-Juhl for our custom size wood frames, which are FSC® and PEFC® certified.

settings.title: Quality & Craftsmanship
settings.content:
At The Selects Gallery, every photograph is a limited-edition piece, created in close partnership with artists and estates to ensure authenticity and market value. Each artwork comes with a Certificate of Authenticity, and we offer archival quality prints produced by renowned fine art photography printing houses under the supervision of the photographers or their estates.

Our museum-quality mounting and framing options include Dibond, Acrylic, Classic Frame, Classic Frame with Mat, and Shadow Box, all crafted to enhance the beauty and longevity of the artwork. Each frame is custom-made and assembled by hand in the US using FSC® and PEFC® certified materials, with high-quality hanging solutions to ensure your art is displayed with the utmost care and sophistication.

settings.text:
Marie Audier D'Alessandris, founder of The Selects Gallery, has over 20 years of experience as an executive in the fashion and beauty industry. During her career, she worked with some of the most talented photographers and creative teams, witnessing many extraordinary images being archived after short-lived use. Motivated to give these images a second life, she established The Selects Gallery.

Marie is passionate about photography, book collecting, and beautiful images. She studied photography development in dark rooms, attended NYU for Art Business Studies, and took MOMA’s Seeing Through Photographs course. She is also an adviser to Red Hook Labs School and a contributor to The Eye of Photography.

Previously, Marie served as the Senior Vice President of Global & North America Marketing for Coach, Inc., and held various marketing positions at L'Oréal in France and the U.S. Born in France, she has lived in Colombia and now resides in New York City with her husband and two boys.

"I bought this image for my 40th birthday. I felt very connected to the woman and her spirit - a glamorous rebel. It helped create a modern and super cool vibe. I get questions and complements about it all the time. Now, I want one for my bedroom!"

“I fell in love with this image which was a gift for my wife. It went from New York to Paris and worked in every house bringing elegance and statement. Marie helped me choose the right framing and we love it!"
“I found The Selects Gallery at Art New York and fell in love with the image by Arthur Belebeau. I enjoy it so much that I hosted a party with friends to celebrate this addition to my home.”

settings.content: Hear what collectors, designers, and curators are saying about their experience with The Selects Gallery.

settings.question: Paper
settings.answer: Our art papers, Canson and Hahnemühle, are sustainably produced and eco-friendly. Hahnemühle paper is 100% vegan, made with renewable energy, and consists of FSC/PEFC-certified fibers, with recycled packaging materials. Canson paper supports sustainable forest management, using wood fibers from non-threatened forests, 70% from forest thinnings and 30% from sawmill offcuts.

settings.question: Frames
settings.answer: We also use Larson-Juhl wood to create our frames. Larson-Juhl wood is FSC® and PEFC certified; this means their wood comes from forests that are managed to meet the social, economic and ecological needs of present and future generations.

settings.question: Ink
settings.answer: We use is archival Epson T800, which comes in recyclable packaging and cartridges. In 2020, Epson was named on the CDP's prestigious A List, attaining the highest scores for the categories of climate change and water security.

settings.question: Mounting & Framing
settings.answer: The framer we work with uses 100% recycled packaging materials and we exclusively use ground transportation. The Selects Gallery consistently looks to progress in our quest for sustainability and holds great respect and appreciation for our environment.

settings.title: Sustainability
settings.content:
The Selects Gallery strives to practice better sustainability through our manufacturing; from on-demand production, and ground shipping, to the paper we print on and the wood we use for framing. We believe that quality is a great way to be sustainable. 

Each piece from the gallery is made to order, this ensures that resources are employed only when there is absolute demand from customers. When practicing on-demand production there is no room for waste and consumer demand is always met exactly.
